Detailed Description

Definitions for mutex operations.

Define Documentation

#define CTK_MUTEX_EA ( mutex_var   )     ((ctk_mutex_ea_t)(unsigned long)(&(mutex_var)))

A macro to get a mutex reference for the given mutex variable.

Parameters:
[in] mutex_var - a mutex variable (ctk_mutex_t)

#define CTK_MUTEX_INITIALIZER   { 0 }

A static initializer for a mutex lock.

#define CTK_MUTEX_PTR ( mutex_ea   )     ((ctk_mutex_t*)(unsigned long)(mutex_ea))

A macro to get a pointer to the mutex variable from the given mutex reference.

Parameters:
[in] mutex_ea - a mutex reference (ctk_mutex_ea_t)

#define CTK_MUTEX_VAR ( mutex_ea   )     (*(ctk_mutex_t*)(unsigned long)(mutex_ea))

A macro to get a mutex variable from the given mutex reference.

Parameters:
[in] mutex_ea - a mutex reference (ctk_mutex_ea_t)

Typedef Documentation

typedef volatile unsigned int ctk_mutex_t __attribute__((aligned(128)))

Mutex type (must be aligned in a 128-bit line)

typedef ea_addr_t ctk_mutex_ea_t

Mutex reference type

Function Documentation

int ctk_mutex_create ( ctk_mutex_ea_t *  mutex  ) 

Creates and initializes a new mutex lock reference. A new mutex lock is allocated (by ctk_sync_alloc) and its reference is returned. (You can also directly declares a ctk_mutex_t static variable and gets a reference for it using CTK_MUTEX_EA macro.)

Parameters:
[out] mutex - a created mutex lock reference.

void ctk_mutex_destroy ( ctk_mutex_ea_t  mutex  ) 

Destroys the given mutex lock reference. Any mutex lock created by ctk_mutex_create must be destroyed by this routine.

Parameters:
[in] mutex - a mutex reference to be destroyed.

static unsigned int ctk_mutex_get_value ( ctk_mutex_ea_t  mutex  )  [inline, static]

Returns a mutex lock value (0 or 1).

Parameters:
[in] mutex - a mutex lock to be examined.

void ctk_mutex_init ( ctk_mutex_ea_t  lock  ) 

Initializes a mutex lock.

Parameters:
[in,out] lock - a mutex lock to be initialized.

void ctk_mutex_lock ( ctk_mutex_ea_t  lock  ) 

Acquires a simple mutex lock. It will wait if the lock is held by any PPU/SPU.

Parameters:
[in] lock - a mutex lock to be acquired. The lock must have been initialized by CTK_MUTEX_INITIALIZER or ctk_mutex_init.
Note:
This mutex_lock just tries to acquire a spin lock and does yield if failed. Use ctk_spin_lock instead if the competing threads are SPU threads and yield does not help the program to run faster.

int ctk_mutex_trylock ( ctk_mutex_ea_t  lock  ) 

Tries to acquire a mutex lock.

Parameters:
[in] lock - a mutex lock to be tried.
Returns:
0 if successfully locked, CTK_ERROR_BUSY (non-zero) otherwise.

void ctk_mutex_unlock ( ctk_mutex_ea_t  lock  ) 

Releases the acquired mutex lock.

Parameters:
[in] lock - a mutex lock to be released.
